channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Venezuela Strongman and Maduro Ally, Diosdado Cabello, Faces an Uneasy Transition
item.description: Diosdado Cabello, Venezuela’s interior minister, is accused by U.S. prosecutors of drug trafficking and is linked to repression at home, yet remains a...

item.title: America’s $952 billion annual burden: Exploding interest on national debt is set to surpass Medicare spending within the decade
item.description: The staggering math behind the rapid rise in interest due on our outsize debt.

item.title: Trump’s immigrant visa crackdown targets Southeast Asia’s Cambodia and Thailand, a decision experts find ‘puzzling’
item.description: “The policy appears less focused on managing migration volumes than on political signaling," says Tan Sook Rei of James Cook University.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Department of War’ rebrand could cost $125 million to replace all the stationery and signs, the CBO says
item.description: A conservative estimate would be $10m, wrote the Congressional Budget Office, but depends on how aggressive the Department of War wants to be with its...

item.title: Nobel Committee Takes Heat at Home as Machado Courts Trump in D.C.
item.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader’s attempts to share her award with the U.S. president have shaken some Norwegians’ faith in their signature soft-powe...

item.title: An NFL-bound college quarterback just turned down a $50 million payday to stay in school and play another season
item.description: More college athletes are putting off going pro amid the growing appeal of and opportunity for NIL deals.

item.title: Verizon offers $20 account credits for 1.5 million customers outraged by mysterious 10-hour-long service outage. Here’s how to get the credit
item.description: The company noted the credit, on average, “covers multiple days of service.”

item.title: Appeals Court Opens the Door to Mahmoud Khalil’s Rearrest
item.description: Any new detention would not come immediately, and Mr. Khalil’s lawyers plan to appeal. But the ruling is a major blow to Mr. Khalil, a Columbia gradua...

item.title: Federal Agent Shoots Man in Minneapolis, Prompting Tense Protests

item.title: Why Trump Always Thanks You ‘For Your Attention to This Matter’
item.description: How a simple catchphrase sums up the president’s theory of executive power.

item.title: What Are Trump’s Options in Iran?
item.description: President Trump has said that “help is on the way” for Iranian protesters. Amid reports that thousands of the protesters have been killed, our nationa...

item.title: UK Conservatives Fire Senior Lawmaker Over ‘Plot’ to Defect
item.description: The leader of Britain’s Conservatives, Kemi Badenoch, said she had ousted Robert Jenrick for “plotting in secret” to defect from and damage the party.
